Intervention: Standard of Care Docetaxel and Cyclophosphamide (TC) Chemotherapy + Surveys. TC Regimen with Function Assessment of Cancer Therapy (FACT) Surveys.
Eligibility: Must have localized or locally advanced breast cancer confirmed histologically for which the treatment plan includes chemotherapy with 4 standard TC cycles (docetaxel 75 mg/m^2 and cyclophosphamide 600 mg/m^2)
Age >/= 65 years (higher adult study with increased risk of toxicity)
Statement of Operations of the Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) < 2
Must have a normal function of the organ and marrow
No pre-existing neuropathy grade > 1 according to common NCI toxicity criteria for adverse reactions (CTCAE) version 4.0
Be menopausal (defined as amenorrheic for at least 12 months)

It is necessary to be informed of the experimental nature of this study and to be willing to give informed consent in writing in accordance with the institutional guidelines and good clinical practice (GCP) indicating that they understand the purpose and procedures for the study and are willing to participate before any specific study procedure begins.

- Uncontrolled disease (including, but not limited to, continuous or active infection, congestive heart failure, angina, or cardiac arrhythmia) that would limit compliance with the requirements of the study
Have a psychiatric illness that would limit compliance with study requirements
Have a history of allergic reactions attributed to compounds of chemical or biological composition similar to taxanes (docetaxel or paclitaxel) or cyclophosphamide
Of which the known seropositivity for human immunodeficiency virus, hepatitis C virus, hepatitis B surface antigen or syphilis.
Not willing to comply with protocol requirements or to give informed consent
Results: • Targeted area under the curve (AUC) achievement rate

In patients > 65 years of age with breast cancer receiving TC (docetaxel and cyclophosphamide) compared to previous unguided PK treatment in patients receiving similar treatment, the PK-guided rate of docetaxel chemotherapy improving the ability to achieve targeted AUC (2.5-3.7 mg*h/L) in the 4 treatment cycles.
